comments.raw_text:
Have a page open an alert. Double click to select one word of the alert. Hit Ctrl-A to select the whole text of the alert. Ctrl-C to copy it. The copy doesn't seem to work, as trying to paste it doesn't seem to paste anything.

If you just double click on a word and try copying it then it works. Or if you select the words with your mouse by dragging it works.

comments.raw_text:
I've performed some tests on different platforms.

Bug does NOT exist:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686 (x86_64); en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16

Bug does exist:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110326 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110326 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110326 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110326 Firefox/4.2a1pre

Thus, the bug exists in 4.2a1pre but NOT in 3.6.16.

The following seems to be irrelevant:
 Windows vs Linux
 32 vs 64 bits operating system
 32 vs 64 bits browser

Observation 1:
When running 4.2a1pre on Windows and trying to copy/paste to notepad it seems like a get a bunch of white space.

Observation 2:
Even on 4.2a1pre I can successfully copy the text by clicking left of "this", then shift-right arrow until the whole text is marked, and then Ctrl-C.
